title: 103_s1178
content: The Act may be cited as the "Great Lakes Federal Effectiveness Act" and establishes the Great Lakes Research Council. The "Great Lakes Federal Effectiveness Act" establishes the Great Lakes Research Council to advise and coordinate federal research activities for ecosystem protection of the Great Lakes. The Council will assess research needs and federal expertise to fulfill the Great Lakes Water Quality Agreement goals. The Great Lakes Research Council will assess research needs, federal expertise, and recommend priorities for federal research on the Great Lakes to fulfill the Water Quality Agreement goals. They will also identify topics for and participate in meetings, workshops, symposia, and conferences on Great Lakes research issues. The Great Lakes Research Council will recommend priorities for Federal research, identify topics for meetings and workshops, make data collection recommendations, establish a data base, and ensure timely dissemination of research findings. The Great Lakes Research Council aims to establish a comprehensive database for the Great Lakes ecosystem and ensure timely dissemination of research findings from Federal Government-sponsored programs. The Council will consist of research managers from key agencies with expertise in the Great Lakes ecosystem. The Great Lakes Research Council will have research managers from key agencies with expertise in the Great Lakes ecosystem. Non-Federal employees may serve as ex officio members, and the Chairperson will be elected by members for a two-year term. Members are entitled to compensation while performing official duties. The Chairperson of the Great Lakes Research Council is elected by members for a two-year term and may not serve for more than two consecutive terms. Members are entitled to compensation for travel expenses while performing official duties. Federal agencies must cooperate with the Council to implement recommendations. The Council shall cooperate with the Great Lakes Research Council to implement recommendations, provide necessary personnel, services, or facilities, and furnish data upon request from the Chairperson to achieve the purposes of the Act. The Council will work with the International Joint Commission for international cooperation and funding. The Act will not affect the authority of any Federal agency for Great Lakes research activities. Sec. 105 defines key terms in the Act, including the Great Lakes Research Council, Great Lakes, Great Lakes research, and Great Lakes Water Quality Agreement. The Great Lakes Research Council utilizes scientific and engineering expertise to understand and predict processes in the Great Lakes ecosystem. The Great Lakes Water Quality Agreement is a bilateral agreement between the United States and Canada signed in 1978 and amended in 1987.
